channel.title: Comments on: Metric vs. Big Audio Dynamite

item.title: By: Eric Greenwood
item.dc:creator: Eric Greenwood
item.description: @stephen O. umm, BAD was horrible. embarrassing, even. if that's what you call "great fun", i shudder at what might be in your music library. and i didn't compare it to the clash, if you'll kindly re-read...
item.content:encoded: @stephen O. umm, BAD was horrible. embarrassing, even. if that’s what you call “great fun”, i shudder at what might be in your music library. and i didn’t compare it to the clash, if you’ll kindly re-read…

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
Interesting. I'm usually the one pointing out these sorts of things. I can kinda hear what you're talking about. I've always thought that something about that song was reminiscent of something else as it is definitely an amalgamation of sounds.
@stephen I don't think anyone was saying anything about appropriation in the 21st century.
item.content:encoded:
Interesting. I’m usually the one pointing out these sorts of things. I can kinda hear what you’re talking about. I’ve always thought that something about that song was reminiscent of something else as it is definitely an amalgamation of sounds.

@stephen I don’t think anyone was saying anything about appropriation in the 21st century.

item.title: By: stephen O.
item.dc:creator: stephen O.
item.description: you've got to be kidding. The resemblance is minimal at best, and besides who the f*** cares about appropriation and inspiration in the 21st century. BAD was just great fun and shouldn't be compared to the Clash, which no-one will ever live up to.
item.content:encoded: you’ve got to be kidding. The resemblance is minimal at best, and besides who the f*** cares about appropriation and inspiration in the 21st century. BAD was just great fun and shouldn’t be compared to the Clash, which no-one will ever live up to.
